entries: Increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. This feat can't increase an ability score above 20.
You can take this feat more than once.
entries.name: Repeatable

feat.name: Ability Score Improvement

entries: You gain the following benefits.
While you're disguised as a real or fictional person, you have Advantage on Charisma ({@skill Deception|XPHB} or {@skill Performance|XPHB}) checks to convince others that you are that person.
entries.name: Impersonation

entries: You can mimic the sounds of other creatures, including speech. A creature that hears the mimicry must succeed on a Wisdom ({@skill Insight|XPHB}) check to determine the effect is faked ({@dc 8} plus your Charisma modifier and Proficiency Bonus).
entries.name: Mimicry

feat.name: Actor

entries: You gain the following benefits.
When you roll Initiative, you can add your Proficiency Bonus to the roll.
entries.name: Initiative Proficiency

entries: Immediately after you roll Initiative, you can swap your Initiative with the Initiative of one willing ally in the same combat. You can't make this swap if you or the ally has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.
entries.name: Initiative Swap

feat.name: Alert

entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with Ranged weapons.
feat.name: Archery

entries: You gain the following benefits.
You gain a Climb Speed equal to your Speed.
entries.name: Climb Speed

entries: When you have the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition, you can right yourself with only 5 feet of movement.
entries.name: Hop Up

entries: You can make a running Long or High Jump after moving only 5 feet.
entries.name: Jumping

feat.name: Athlete

entries: You learn two {@filter Cleric cantrips|spells|level=0|class=Cleric} of your choice. {@spell Guidance|XPHB} and {@spell Sacred Flame|XPHB} are recommended. The chosen cantrips count as Paladin spells for you, and Charisma is your spellcasting ability for them. Whenever you gain a Paladin level, you can replace one of these cantrips with another Cleric cantrip.
feat.name: Blessed Warrior

otherSummary.entry: When Gaining the Level 2 Paladin "Fighting Style" Feature

entries: You have {@sense Blindsight|XPHB} with a range of 10 feet.
feat.name: Blind Fighting

entries: You gain the following benefits.
When you miss with an attack roll, you can hit instead. Once you use this benefit, you can't use it again until the start of your next turn.
entries.name: Peerless Aim

feat.name: Boon of Combat Prowess

entries: You gain the following benefits.
Immediately after you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action or the {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.
entries.name: Blink Steps

feat.name: Boon of Dimensional Travel

entries: You gain the following benefits.

You gain Resistance to two of the following damage types of your choice: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Necrotic, Poison, Psychic, Radiant, or Thunder. Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can change your choices.
entries.name: Energy Resistances

entries: When you take damage of one of the types chosen for the Energy Resistances benefit, you can take a Reaction to direct damage of the same type toward another creature you can see within 60 feet of yourself that isn't behind Total Cover. If you do so, that creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw ({@dc 8} plus your Constitution modifier and Proficiency Bonus) or take damage equal to {@dice 2d12} plus your Constitution modifier.
entries.name: Energy Redirection

feat.name: Boon of Energy Resistance

entries: You gain the following benefits.

When you or another creature within 60 feet of you succeeds on or fails a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, you can roll {@dice 2d4} and apply the total rolled as a bonus or penalty to the {@dice d20} roll. Once you use this benefit, you can't use it again until you roll Initiative or finish a Short or Long Rest.
entries.name: Improve Fate

feat.name: Boon of Fate

entries: You gain the following benefits.

Your Hit Point maximum increases by 40. In addition, whenever you regain Hit Points, you can regain additional Hit Points equal to your Constitution modifier. Once you've regained these additional Hit Points, you can't do so again until the start of your next turn.
entries.name: Fortified Health

feat.name: Boon of Fortitude

entries: You gain the following benefits.
The Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage you deal always ignores Resistance.
entries.name: Overcome Defenses

entries: When you roll a 20 on the {@dice d20} for an attack roll, you can deal extra damage to the target equal to the ability score increased by this feat. The extra damage's type is the same as the attack's type.
entries.name: Overwhelming Strike

feat.name: Boon of Irresistible Offense

entries: You gain the following benefits.

When you would be reduced to 0 Hit Points, you can drop to 1 Hit Point instead and regain a number of Hit Points equal to half your Hit Point maximum. Once you use this benefit, you can't use it again until you finish a Long Rest.
entries.name: Last Stand

entries: You have a pool of ten d10s. As a Bonus Action, you can expend dice from the pool, roll those dice, and regain a number of Hit Points equal to the roll's total. You regain all the expended dice when you finish a Long Rest.
entries.name: Recover Vitality

feat.name: Boon of Recovery

entries: You gain the following benefits.
You gain proficiency in all skills.
entries.name: All-Around Adept

entries: Choose one skill in which you lack Expertise. You gain Expertise in that skill.
entries.name: Expertise

feat.name: Boon of Skill

entries: You gain the following benefits.
As a Bonus Action, you can take the {@action Disengage|XPHB} action, which also ends the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition on you.
entries.name: Escape Artist

entries: Your Speed increases by 30 feet.
entries.name: Quickness

feat.name: Boon of Speed

entries: You gain the following benefits.
Whenever you cast a spell with a level 1-4 spell slot, roll {@dice 1d4}. If the number you roll is the same as the slot's level, the slot isn't expended.
entries.name: Free Casting

feat.name: Boon of Spell Recall

entries: You gain the following benefits.

While within Dim Light or Darkness, you can give yourself the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition as a Bonus Action. The condition ends on you immediately after you take an action, a Bonus Action, or a Reaction.
entries.name: Merge with Shadows

entries: While within Dim Light or Darkness, you have Resistance to all damage except Psychic and Radiant.
entries.name: Shadowy Form

feat.name: Boon of the Night Spirit

entries: You gain the following benefits.
You have {@sense Truesight|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet.
entries.name: Truesight

feat.name: Boon of Truesight

entries: You gain the following benefits.
When you take the {@action Dash|XPHB} action, your Speed increases by 10 feet for that action.
entries.name: Improved Dash

entries: If you move at least 10 feet in a straight line toward a target immediately before hitting it with a melee attack roll as part of the {@action Attack|XPHB} action, choose one of the following effects: gain a {@dice 1d8} bonus to the attack's damage roll, or push the target up to 10 feet away if it is no more than one size larger than you. You can use this benefit only once on each of your turns.
entries.name: Charge Attack

feat.name: Charger

entries: You gain the following benefits.
You gain proficiency with Cook's Utensils if you don't already have it.
entries.name: Cook's Utensils

entries: As part of a Short Rest, you can cook special food if you have ingredients and Cook's Utensils on hand. You can prepare enough of this food for a number of creatures equal to 4 plus your Proficiency Bonus. At the end of the Short Rest, any creature who eats the food and spends one or more Hit Dice to regain Hit Points regains an extra {@dice 1d8} Hit Points.
entries.name: Replenishing Meal

entries: With 1 hour of work or when you finish a Long Rest, you can cook a number of treats equal to your Proficiency Bonus if you have ingredients and Cook's Utensils on hand. These special treats last 8 hours after being made. A creature can use a Bonus Action to eat one of those treats to gain a number of Temporary Hit Points equal to your Proficiency Bonus.
entries.name: Bolstering Treats

feat.name: Chef

entries: You gain the following benefits.
You gain proficiency with three different Artisan's Tools of your choice from the Fast Crafting table.
entries.name: Tool Proficiency

entries: Whenever you buy a nonmagical item, you receive a 20 percent discount on it.
entries.name: Discount

entries: When you finish a Long Rest, you can craft one piece of gear from the Fast Crafting table, provided you have the Artisan's Tools associated with that item and have proficiency with those tools. The item lasts until you finish another Long Rest, at which point the item falls apart.

entries.caption: Fast Crafting
rows: {@item Crossbow Bolt Case|XPHB}, {@item Map or Scroll Case|XPHB}, {@item Pouch|XPHB}
{@item Ball Bearings|XPHB}, {@item Bucket|XPHB}, {@item Caltrops|XPHB}, {@item Grappling Hook|XPHB}, {@item Iron Pot|XPHB}

entries.name: Fast Crafting

feat.name: Crafter

entries: You gain the following benefits.

You ignore the Loading property of the Hand Crossbow, Heavy Crossbow, and Light Crossbow (all called crossbows elsewhere in this feat). If you're holding one of them, you can load a piece of ammunition into it even if you lack a free hand.
entries.name: Ignore Loading

entries: Being within 5 feet of an enemy doesn't impose Disadvantage on your attack rolls with crossbows.
entries.name: Firing in Melee

entries: When you make the extra attack of the Light property, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the extra attack if that attack is with a crossbow that has the Light property and you aren't already adding that modifier to the damage.
entries.name: Dual Wielding

feat.name: Crossbow Expert

entries: You gain the following benefits.
Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an attack that deals Bludgeoning damage, you can move it 5 feet to an unoccupied space if the target is no more than one size larger than you.
entries.name: Push

entries: When you score a Critical Hit that deals Bludgeoning damage to a creature, attack rolls against that creature have Advantage until the start of your next turn.
entries.name: Enhanced Critical

feat.name: Crusher

entries: While you're wearing Light, Medium, or Heavy armor, you gain a +1 bonus to Armor Class.
feat.name: Defense

entries: You gain the following benefits.

If you're holding a Finesse weapon and another creature hits you with a melee attack, you can take a Reaction to add your Proficiency Bonus to your Armor Class, potentially causing the attack to miss you. You gain this bonus to your AC against melee attacks until the start of your next turn.
entries.name: Parry

feat.name: Defensive Duelist

entries: You learn two {@filter Druid cantrips|spells|level=0|class=druid} of your choice. {@spell Guidance|XPHB} and {@spell Starry Wisp|XPHB} are recommended. The chosen cantrips count as Ranger spells for you, and Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for them. Whenever you gain a Ranger level, you can replace one of these cantrips with another Druid cantrip.
feat.name: Druidic Warrior

otherSummary.entry: When Gaining the Level 2 Ranger "Fighting Style" Feature

entries: You gain the following benefits.

When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn and attack with a weapon that has the Light property, you can make one extra attack as a Bonus Action later on the same turn with a different weapon, which must be a Melee weapon that lacks the Two-Handed property. You don't add your ability modifier to the extra attack's damage unless that modifier is negative.
entries.name: Enhanced Dual Wielding

entries: You can draw or stow two weapons that lack the Two-Handed property when you would normally be able to draw or stow only one.
entries.name: Quick Draw

feat.name: Dual Wielder

entries: When you're holding a Melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.
feat.name: Dueling

entries: You gain the following benefits.
You have Advantage on Death Saving Throws.
entries.name: Defy Death

entries: As a Bonus Action, you can expend one of your Hit Point Dice, roll the die, and regain a number of Hit Points equal to the roll.
entries.name: Speedy Recovery

feat.name: Durable

entries: You gain the following benefits.

Choose one of the following damage types: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder. Spells you cast ignore Resistance to damage of the chosen type. In addition, when you roll damage for a spell you cast that deals damage of that type, you can treat any 1 on a damage die as a 2.
entries.name: Energy Mastery

entries: You can take this feat more than once, but you must choose a different damage type each time for Energy Mastery.
entries.name: Repeatable

feat.name: Elemental Adept

entries: Your exposure to the Feywild's magic grants you the following benefits.

Choose one level 1 spell from the {@filter Divination or Enchantment|spells|level=1|school=E;D} school of magic. You always have that spell and the {@spell Misty Step|XPHB} spell prepared. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. Once you cast either spell in this way, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a Long Rest. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spells' spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.
entries.name: Fey Magic

feat.name: Fey-Touched

entries: You gain the following benefits.

When you hit a creature with an Unarmed Strike as part of the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn, you can use both the Damage and the Grapple option. You can use this benefit only once per turn.
entries.name: Punch and Grab

entries: You have Advantage on attack rolls against a creature {@condition Grappled|XPHB} by you.
entries.name: Attack Advantage

entries: You don't have to spend extra movement to move a creature {@condition Grappled|XPHB} by you if the creature is your size or smaller.
entries.name: Fast Wrestler

feat.name: Grappler

entries: When you roll damage for an attack you make with a Melee weapon that you are holding with two hands, you can treat any 1 or 2 on a damage die as a 3. The weapon must have the Two-Handed or Versatile property to gain this benefit.
feat.name: Great Weapon Fighting

entries: You gain the following benefits.

When you hit a creature with a weapon that has the Heavy property as part of the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn, you can cause the weapon to deal extra damage to the target. The extra damage equals your Proficiency Bonus.
entries.name: Heavy Weapon Mastery

entries: Immediately after you score a Critical Hit with a Melee weapon or reduce a creature to 0 Hit Points with one, you can make one attack with the same weapon as a Bonus Action.
entries.name: Hew

feat.name: Great Weapon Master

entries: You gain the following benefits.

If you have a Healer's Kit, you can expend one use of it and tend to a creature within 5 feet of yourself as a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action. That creature can expend one of its Hit Point Dice, and you then roll that die. The creature regains a number of Hit Points equal to the roll plus your Proficiency Bonus.
entries.name: Battle Medic

entries: Whenever you roll a die to determine the number of Hit Points you restore with a spell or with this feat's Battle Medic benefit, you can reroll the die if it rolls a 1, and you must use the new roll.
entries.name: Healing Rerolls

feat.name: Healer

entries: You gain the following benefits.
You gain training with Heavy armor.
entries.name: Armor Training

feat.name: Heavily Armored

entries: You gain the following benefits.
When you're hit by an attack while you're wearing Heavy armor, any Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage dealt to you by that attack is reduced by an amount equal to your Proficiency Bonus.
entries.name: Damage Reduction

feat.name: Heavy Armor Master

entries: You gain the following benefits.

When you finish a Short or Long Rest, you can give an inspiring performance: a speech, song, or dance. When you do so, choose up to six allies (which can include yourself) within 30 feet of yourself who witness the performance. The chosen creatures each gain Temporary Hit Points equal to your character level plus the modifier of the ability you increased with this feat.
entries.name: Bolstering Performance

feat.name: Inspiring Leader

entries: When a creature you can see hits another creature within 5 feet of you with an attack roll, you can take a Reaction to reduce the damage dealt to the target by {@dice 1d10} plus your Proficiency Bonus. You must be holding a Shield or a Simple or Martial weapon to use this Reaction.
feat.name: Interception

entries: You gain the following benefits.

Choose one of the following skills: {@skill Arcana|XPHB}, {@skill History|XPHB}, {@skill Investigation|XPHB}, {@skill Nature|XPHB}, or {@skill Religion|XPHB}. If you lack proficiency in the chosen skill, you gain proficiency in it, and if you already have proficiency in it, you gain Expertise in it.
entries.name: Lore Knowledge

entries: You can take the {@action Study|XPHB} action as a Bonus Action.
entries.name: Quick Study

feat.name: Keen Mind

entries: You gain the following benefits.
You gain training with Light armor and Shields.
entries.name: Armor Training

feat.name: Lightly Armored

entries: You gain the following benefits.
You have a number of Luck Points equal to your Proficiency Bonus and can spend the points on the benefits below. You regain your expended Luck Points when you finish a Long Rest.
entries.name: Luck Points

entries: When you roll a {@dice d20} for a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, you can spend 1 Luck Point to give yourself Advantage on the roll.
entries.name: Advantage

entries: When a creature rolls a {@dice d20} for an attack roll against you, you can spend 1 Luck Point to impose Disadvantage on that roll.
entries.name: Disadvantage

feat.name: Lucky

entries: You gain the following benefits.
When you damage a creature that is {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating}, it has Disadvantage on the saving throw it makes to maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB}.
entries.name: Concentration Breaker

entries: If you fail an Intelligence, a Wisdom, or a Charisma saving throw, you can cause yourself to succeed instead. Once you use this benefit, you can't use it again until you finish a Short or Long Rest.
entries.name: Guarded Mind

feat.name: Mage Slayer

entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the {@filter Cleric|spells|level=0;1|class=Cleric} spell list. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this feat's spells (choose when you select this feat).
items.name: Two Cantrips

entries: Choose a level 1 spell from the {@filter Cleric|spells|level=0;1|class=Cleric} spell list. You always have that spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a Long Rest. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have.
items.name: Level 1 Spell

entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the {@filter Druid|spells|level=0;1|class=Druid} spell list. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this feat's spells (choose when you select this feat).
items.name: Two Cantrips

entries: Choose a level 1 spell from the {@filter Druid|spells|level=0;1|class=Druid} spell list. You always have that spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a Long Rest. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have.
items.name: Level 1 Spell

entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the {@filter Wizard|spells|level=0;1|class=Wizard} spell list. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this feat's spells (choose when you select this feat).
items.name: Two Cantrips

entries: Choose a level 1 spell from the {@filter Wizard|spells|level=0;1|class=Wizard} spell list. You always have that spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a Long Rest. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have.
items.name: Level 1 Spell

entries: You gain the following benefits.

You learn two cantrips of your choice from the {@filter Cleric|spells|level=0;1|class=Cleric}, {@filter Druid|spells|level=0;1|class=Druid}, or {@filter Wizard|spells|level=0;1|class=Wizard} spell list. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this feat's spells (choose when you select this feat).
entries.name: Two Cantrips

entries: Choose a level 1 spell from the same list you selected for this feat's cantrips. You always have that spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a Long Rest. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have.
entries.name: Level 1 Spell

entries: Whenever you gain a new level, you can replace one of the spells you chose for this feat with a different spell of the same level from the chosen spell list.
entries.name: Spell Change

entries: You can take this feat more than once, but you must choose a different spell list each time.
entries.name: Repeatable

feat.name: Magic Initiate

entries: You gain the following benefits.
You gain proficiency with {@filter Martial weapons|items|type=martial weapon}.
entries.name: Weapon Proficiency

feat.name: Martial Weapon Training

entries: You gain the following benefits.
While you're wearing Medium armor, you can add 3, rather than 2 to your AC if you have a Dexterity score of 16 or higher.
entries.name: Dexterous Wearer

feat.name: Medium Armor Master

entries: You gain the following benefits.
You gain training with Medium armor.
entries.name: Armor Training

feat.name: Moderately Armored

entries: You gain the following benefits.
While {@book mounted|XPHB|1|Mounted Combat}, you have Advantage on attack rolls against any unmounted creature within 5 feet of your mount that is at least one size smaller than the mount.
entries.name: Mounted Strike

entries: If your mount is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw and only half damage if it fails. For your mount to gain this benefit, you must be riding it, and neither of you can have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.
entries.name: Leap Aside

entries: While {@book mounted|XPHB|1|Mounted Combat}, you can force an attack that hits your mount to hit you instead if you don't have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.
entries.name: Veer

feat.name: Mounted Combatant

entries: You gain the following benefits.
You gain proficiency with three Musical Instruments of your choice.
entries.name: Instrument Training

entries: As you finish a Short or Long Rest, you can play a song on a Musical Instrument with which you have proficiency and give {@variantrule Heroic Inspiration|XPHB} to allies who hear the song. The number of allies you can affect in this way equals your Proficiency Bonus.
entries.name: Encouraging Song

feat.name: Musician

entries: You gain the following benefits.

Choose one of the following skills: {@skill Insight|XPHB}, {@skill Investigation|XPHB}, or {@skill Perception|XPHB}. If you lack proficiency with the chosen skill, you gain proficiency in it, and if you already have proficiency in it, you gain Expertise in it.
entries.name: Keen Observer

entries: You can take the {@action Search|XPHB} action as a Bonus Action.
entries.name: Quick Search

feat.name: Observant

entries: You gain the following benefits.
Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an attack that deals Piercing damage, you can reroll one of the attack's damage dice, and you must use the new roll.
entries.name: Puncture

entries: When you score a Critical Hit that deals Piercing damage to a creature, you can roll one additional damage die when determining the extra Piercing damage the target takes.
entries.name: Enhanced Critical

feat.name: Piercer

entries: You gain the following benefits.
When you make a damage roll that deals Poison damage, it ignores Resistance to Poison damage.
entries.name: Potent Poison

entries: You gain proficiency with the Poisoner's Kit. With 1 hour of work using such a kit and expending 50 GP worth of materials, you can create a number of poison doses equal to your Proficiency Bonus. As a Bonus Action, you can apply a poison dose to a weapon or piece of ammunition. Once applied, the poison retains its potency for 1 minute or until you deal damage with the poisoned item, whichever is shorter. When a creature takes damage from the poisoned item, that creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw ({@dc 8} plus the modifier of the ability increased by this feat and your Proficiency Bonus) or take {@damage 2d8} Poison damage and have the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn.
entries.name: Brew Poison

feat.name: Poisoner

entries: You gain the following benefits.

Immediately after you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action and attack with a {@item Quarterstaff|XPHB}, a {@item Spear|XPHB}, or a {@filter weapon that has the Heavy and Reach properties|items|type=melee weapon;ranged weapon|property=heavy;reach}, you can use a Bonus Action to make a melee attack with the opposite end of the weapon. The weapon deals Bludgeoning damage, and the weapon's damage die for this attack is a {@dice d4}.
entries.name: Pole Strike

entries: While you're holding a {@item Quarterstaff|XPHB}, a {@item Spear|XPHB}, or a {@filter weapon that has the Heavy and Reach properties|items|type=melee weapon;ranged weapon|property=heavy;reach}, you can take a Reaction to make one melee attack against a creature that enters the reach you have with that weapon.
entries.name: Reactive Strike

feat.name: Polearm Master

entries: When a creature you can see attacks a target other than you that is within 5 feet of you, you can take a Reaction to interpose your Shield if you're holding one. You impose Disadvantage on the triggering attack roll and all other attack rolls against the target until the start of your next turn if you remain within 5 feet of the target.
feat.name: Protection

choose.entry: Choose one ability in which you lack saving throw proficiency. Increase the chosen ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

entries: You gain the following benefits.
You gain saving throw proficiency with the chosen ability.
entries.name: Saving Throw Proficiency

feat.name: Resilient

entries: You gain the following benefits.

Choose a number of level 1 spells equal to your Proficiency Bonus that have the {@filter Ritual tag|spells|level=1|components & miscellaneous=ritual}. You always have those spells prepared, and you can cast them with any spell slots you have. The spells' spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat. Whenever your Proficiency Bonus increases thereafter, you can add an additional level 1 spell with the Ritual tag to the spells always prepared with this feature.
entries.name: Ritual Spells

entries: With this benefit, you can cast a Ritual spell that you have prepared using its regular casting time rather than the extended time for a Ritual. Doing so doesn't require a spell slot. Once you cast the spell in this way, you can't use this benefit again until you finish a Long Rest.
entries.name: Quick Ritual

feat.name: Ritual Caster

entries: You've trained to deal particularly damaging strikes. Once per turn when you hit a target with a weapon, you can roll the weapon's damage dice twice and use either roll against the target.
feat.name: Savage Attacker

entries: You gain the following benefits.

Immediately after a creature within 5 feet of you takes the {@action Disengage|XPHB} action or hits a target other than you with an attack, you can make an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB} against that creature.
entries.name: Guardian

entries: When you hit a creature with an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB}, the creature's Speed becomes 0 for the rest of the current turn.
entries.name: Halt

feat.name: Sentinel

entries: Your exposure to the Shadowfell's magic grants you the following benefits.

Choose one {@filter level 1 spell|spells|level=1|school=I;N} from the Illusion or Necromancy school of magic. You always have that spell and the {@spell Invisibility|XPHB} spell prepared. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. Once you cast either spell in this way, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a Long Rest. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spells' spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.
entries.name: Shadow Magic

feat.name: Shadow-Touched

entries: You gain the following benefits.
Your ranged attacks with weapons ignore Half Cover and Three-Quarters Cover.
entries.name: Bypass Cover

entries: Being within 5 feet of an enemy doesn't impose Disadvantage on your attack rolls with Ranged weapons.
entries.name: Firing in Melee

entries: Attacking at long range doesn't impose Disadvantage on your attack rolls with Ranged weapons.
entries.name: Long Shots

feat.name: Sharpshooter

entries: You gain the following benefits.

If you attack a creature within 5 feet of you as part of the {@action Attack|XPHB} action and hit with a Melee weapon, you can immediately bash the target with your Shield if it's equipped, forcing the target to make a Strength saving throw ({@dc 8} plus your Strength modifier and Proficiency Bonus). On a failed save, you either push the target 5 feet from you or cause it to have the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition (your choice). You can use this benefit only once on each of your turns.
entries.name: Shield Bash

entries: If you're subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you can take a Reaction to take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw and are holding a Shield.
entries.name: Interpose Shield

feat.name: Shield Master

entries: You gain the following benefits.
You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice.
entries.name: Skill Proficiency

entries: Choose one skill in which you have proficiency but lack Expertise. You gain Expertise with that skill.
entries.name: Expertise

feat.name: Skill Expert

entries: You gain proficiency in any combination of three {@table Skill List; Skills|XPHB|skills} or {@filter tools|items|type=tool;artisan's tools;instrument;gaming set;vehicle (land);vehicle (water)} of your choice.
You can take this feat more than once.
entries.name: Repeatable

feat.name: Skilled

entries: You gain the following benefits.
You have {@sense Blindsight|XPHB} with a range of 10 feet.
entries.name: Blindsight

entries: You exploit the distractions of battle, gaining Advantage on any Dexterity ({@skill Stealth|XPHB}) check you make as part of the {@action Hide|XPHB} action during combat.
entries.name: Fog of War

entries: If you make an attack roll while hidden and the roll misses, making the attack roll doesn't reveal your location.
entries.name: Sniper

feat.name: Skulker

entries: You gain the following benefits.
Once per turn when you hit a creature with an attack that deals Slashing damage, you can reduce the Speed of that creature by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.
entries.name: Hamstring

entries: When you score a Critical Hit that deals Slashing damage to a creature, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of your next turn.
entries.name: Enhanced Critical

feat.name: Slasher

entries: You gain the following benefits.
Your Speed increases by 10 feet.
entries.name: Speed Increase

entries: When you take the {@action Dash|XPHB} action on your turn, Difficult Terrain doesn't cost you extra movement for the rest of that turn.
entries.name: Dash over Difficult Terrain

entries: Opportunity Attacks have Disadvantage against you.
entries.name: Agile Movement

feat.name: Speedy

entries: You gain the following benefits.
Your attack rolls for spells ignore Half Cover and Three-Quarters Cover.
entries.name: Bypass Cover

entries: Being within 5 feet of an enemy doesn't impose Disadvantage on your attack rolls with spells.
entries.name: Casting in Melee

entries: When you cast a spell that has a range of at least 10 feet and requires you to make an attack roll, you can increase the spell's range by 60 feet.
entries.name: Increased Range

feat.name: Spell Sniper

entries: You gain the following benefits.
When you hit with your Unarmed Strike and deal damage, you can deal Bludgeoning damage equal to {@damage 1d4} plus your Strength modifier instead of the normal damage of an Unarmed Strike.
entries.name: Enhanced Unarmed Strike

entries: Whenever you roll a damage die for your Unarmed Strike, you can reroll the die if it rolls a 1, and you must use the new roll.
entries.name: Damage Rerolls

entries: You have proficiency with improvised weapons.
entries.name: Improvised Weaponry

entries: When you hit a creature with an Unarmed Strike as part of the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn, you can deal damage to the target and also push it 5 feet away from you. You can use this benefit only once per turn.
entries.name: Push

feat.name: Tavern Brawler

entries: You gain the following benefits.

You learn the {@spell Mage Hand|XPHB} spell. You can cast it without Verbal or Somatic components, you can make the spectral hand {@condition Invisible|XPHB}, and its range and the distance it can be away from you both increase by 30 feet when you cast it. The spell's spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.
entries.name: Minor Telekinesis

entries: As a Bonus Action, you can telekinetically shove one creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself. When you do so, the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw ({@dc 8} plus the ability modifier of the score increased by this feat and your Proficiency Bonus) or be moved 5 feet toward or away from you.
entries.name: Telekinetic Shove

feat.name: Telekinetic

entries: You gain the following benefits.

You can speak telepathically to any creature you can see within 60 feet of yourself. Your telepathic utterances are in a language you know, and the creature understands you only if it knows that language. Your communication doesn't give the creature the ability to respond to you telepathically.
entries.name: Telepathic Utterance

entries: You always have the {@spell Detect Thoughts|XPHB} spell prepared. You can cast it without a spell slot or spell components, and you must finish a Long Rest before you can cast it in this way again. You can also cast it using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Your spellcasting ability for the spell is the ability increased by this feat.
entries.name: Detect Thoughts

feat.name: Telepathic

entries: When you hit with a ranged attack roll using a weapon that has the Thrown property, you gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll.
feat.name: Thrown Weapon Fighting

entries: Your Hit Point maximum increases by an amount equal to twice your character level when you gain this feat. Whenever you gain a character level thereafter, your Hit Point maximum increases by an additional 2 Hit Points.
feat.name: Tough

entries: When you make an extra attack as a result of using a weapon that has the Light property, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of that attack if you aren't already adding it to the damage.
feat.name: Two-Weapon Fighting

entries: When you hit with your Unarmed Strike and deal damage, you can deal Bludgeoning damage equal to {@damage 1d6} plus your Strength modifier instead of the normal damage of an Unarmed Strike. If you aren't holding any weapons or a Shield when you make the attack roll, the {@dice d6} becomes a {@dice d8}.
At the start of each of your turns, you can deal {@damage 1d4} Bludgeoning damage to one creature {@condition Grappled|XPHB} by you.
feat.name: Unarmed Fighting

entries: You gain the following benefits.
You have Advantage on Constitution saving throws that you make to maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB}.
entries.name: Concentration

entries: When a creature provokes an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB} from you by leaving your reach, you can take a Reaction to cast a spell at the creature rather than making an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB}. The spell must have a casting time of one action and must target only that creature.
entries.name: Reactive Spell

entries: You can perform the Somatic components of spells even when you have weapons or a Shield in one or both hands.
entries.name: Somatic Components

feat.name: War Caster

entries: You gain the following benefits.

Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery property of one kind of Simple or Martial weapon of your choice, provided you have proficiency with it. Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can change the kind of weapon to another eligible kind.
entries.name: Mastery Property

feat.name: Weapon Master

activation.condition: Immediately after you take the Attack action
Whenever you finish a Long Rest
When you or another creature within 60 feet of you succeeds or fails a D20 Test
When you would be reduced to 0 Hit Points
Whenever you cast a spell with a level 1-4 spell slot
If you move at least 10 feet in a straight line immediately before hitting it with a melee attack
As part of a Short Rest
When you hit a creature with a weapon that has the Heavy property as part of the Attack action on your turn
When you finish a Short or Long Rest
When you finish a Short or Long Rest
When a creature you can see hits another creature within 5 feet of you with an attack roll
When you roll a d20 for a D20 Test
When a creature rolls a d20 for an attack roll against you
When you fail an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw

effects.description: When a creature takes damage from the poisoned item, that creature must succeed on a [[/save ability=con]] saving throw (DC 8 plus the modifier of the ability increased by this feat and your Proficiency Bonus) or take 2d8 Poison damage and have the &Reference[Poisoned] condition until the end of your next turn.
effects.name: Poisoned (Dex)

effects.description: When a creature takes damage from the poisoned item, that creature must succeed on a [[/save ability=con]] saving throw (DC 8 plus the modifier of the ability increased by this feat and your Proficiency Bonus) or take 2d8 Poison damage and have the &Reference[Poisoned] condition until the end of your next turn.
effects.name: Poisoned (Int)

activation.condition: When a creature you can see attacks a target other than you within 5 feet of you
If you hit a creature with a Melee weapon within 5 feet of you as part of the Attack action
At the start of each of your turns
